answers.answer: HiProteinuria may suggest the presence of nephrotic syndrome or nephritis. Underlying systemic conditions like diabetes and hypertension also needs to be ruled out. A 24 hour urine collection may be needed to quantitate urinary protein levels. Lipid profile, a complete blood count, serum albumin level, BUN , creatinine levels should also be determined. A CT scan of the kidneys ,ureter and bladder will also help.Are there other associated conditions like swelling of the face or extremities?

question: what kind of test do you need if your protein in your urine is higher than 300
title: proteins in urine
